thread.title: Sounders will play Galaxy with football lines on field at CenturyLink
thread.title_full: Sounders will play Galaxy with football lines on field at CenturyLink

author: Matt Pentz
title: Sounders will play Galaxy with football lines on field at CenturyLink
text:
Sounders will play Galaxy with football lines on field at CenturyLink Originally published October 2, 2015 at 5:30 pm By Matt Pentz Seattle Times staff reporter 
With the Seahawks playing at home against the Lions on Monday night, there will be some football lines on the CenturyLink Field turf for Sunday’s nationally televised match between the Sounders and Los Angeles Galaxy. 
A gap of 18 to 20 hours between games is required for a clean field, Sounders owner Adrian Hanauer said, a window tighter than it used to be and one that continues to shrink. 
“My personal goal, and it’s going to take a lot of innovation and technology and a ton of hard work,” Hanauer said, “but at some point, I’d like to get to the point where we could play a game on Saturday evening and have the Seahawks play a game on Sunday afternoon, with pure soccer lines on Saturday night and NFL lines on a Sunday. I think it’s possible.” Matt Pentz : 206-464-3184 or mpentz@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @mattpentz . Matt Pentz covers Sounders FC, Reign FC, MLS and world soccer for The Seattle Times throughout the year.
